intro: Perityle jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco perityle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Perityle jaliscana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
